snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission is paying a trading firm for software that will give the agency its first real-time window on an increasingly sophisticated stock market.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission is paying high-frequency trading firm Tradeworx for software that will give the agency its first real-time window on an increasingly sophisticated stock market; program is part of broader effort to monitor proliferation of new technologies and to crack down on practices that give traders advantage over ordinary investors.

byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and BEN PROTESS

lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission is paying a trading firm for software that will give the agency its first real-time window on an increasingly sophisticated stock market.

headline.seo: S.E.C. Regulators Turn to High-Speed Trading Firm
headline.main: To Regulate Rapid Traders, S.E.C. Turns to One of Them
headline.print_headline: To Regulate High-Speed Traders, S.E.C. Turns to One of Them
